intro: Krenakia venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan krenakia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of Venezuela. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments, typically in rocky or mountainous areas with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
